title: Why the hell does trapping a champ with Yorick's cage proc turret aggro?
body: This stupid bugs been around since his re-release and it's really annoying that it's still a thing. Also the fact that it can be destroyed by a single turret shot regardless of its rank makes me wonder why I try to use it at all in a dive sometimes.

replies.body: It should only proc aggro if they hit the edges due to it being a knockup. Never seen just placing it proc aggro.
It could possibly work like Veigar's cage, where it deals 1 true damage on the inside of the cage, to ensure you still get an assist even if you don't land the stun.

Haven't seen it work that way with {{champion:60}} cocoon. Someone tried to argue the other day it was fair since {{champion:60}} cocoon procs turret aggro as well... only I tested it and it doesn't.
That's because Elise's cocoon is a CC, which directly gives you assist credit. The 1 true damage for Veigar's cage is when he *doesn't* get the stun off.
If Veigar doesnt hit E he shoudlnt get kill credit Is he getting free ap off of that?

He gets an assist off of it, because trapping someone in the cage is as good as stunning them most of the time. For direct spell hit, he doesn't get AP unless he gets the stun, but I'm not sure about getting AP from champion takedowns with a stun free cage assist
Iirc he will get the assist and the AP for the assist.
Does the 1 True damage proc {{item:2139}}  Damage and can basically kill a champ?

Pretty sure that's not the case. People would definitely notice that with Veigar. Chances are it's actually not true damage, but health reduction, which would explain why it doesn't proc the Elixir, Luden's, Liandry's, etc. and also why death recap never shows these cages having dealt 1 damage.

There was a Vandiril video where he gets a pentakill (staged, ofc) from casting Anivia wall, using the true damage proc. It may have been changed recently, but it definitely was a thing at some point.
